text: Injera is a type of unleavened flatbread. It is made by flour (either from teff, wheat, or sorghum) and water. It is then fermented until sour. It has a spongy texture. It is known to be eaten in Ethiopia, Eritrea, Djibouti, and Somalia. It can either be eaten as a side or used to put some foods on top of it. ==References== Category:Flatbreads Category:Ethiopian food Category:Eritrean food Category:Djiboutian food Category:Somali food Category:African foods
title: Injera
